intro: Tetradenia hayatae, commonly known as the Japanese tetradenia, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its foliage is often used in traditional Japanese medicine for its purported health benefits. Tetradenia hayatae is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
